results.definition: postpone doing what one should be doing
small individual study area in a library
a booth where articles are displayed for sale

examples: The car stalled in the driveway

results.definition: small area set off by walls for special use
a tactic used to mislead or delay
a compartment in a stable where a single animal is confined and fed
a malfunction in the flight of an aircraft in which there is a sudden loss of lift that results in a downward plunge
examples: the plane went into a stall and I couldn't control it

results.definition: cause an airplane to go into a stall

examples: The inexperienced driver kept stalling the car

results.definition: deliberately delay an event or action
examples: she doesn't want to write the report, so she is stalling

results.definition: experience a stall in flight, of airplanes
put into, or keep in, a stall
seating in the forward part of the main level of a theater
inRegion: united kingdom of great britain and northern ireland
